Exaggerate: The expert's verdict suggests that President Trump has exaggerated the situation by emphasizing and describing surges in other countries in a way that could lead audiences to believe that the US is in better shape than certain parts of Europe and Asia.
Contradict fact: The expert's verdict points out that President Trump has distorted the facts on the coronavirus pandemic in his remarks and tweets.
Lack enough support: The expert's verdict mentions that the White House did not respond to their request for more information, indicating a lack of support for the claims made by President Trump.
Problematic assumption: The expert's verdict suggests that President Trump's assumption that the US has done as well as any nation is problematic, as there are countries that have successfully reduced their case numbers to low levels in May and June, which the US did not manage to do.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert's verdict mentions that the large changes in case numbers in the countries mentioned by President Trump were only possible because those countries had very few new coronavirus cases in early June. This suggests that there may be alternative explanations for the differences in case numbers between the US and other countries.
